org.mini2Dx.yarn

Class YarnState

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mini2Dx.yarn.YarnState

  • public class YarnState
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores the current state of execution through a YarnTree

      Constructor and Description
      YarnState() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String applyVariables(java.lang.String text)
      Replaces any {{ }} wrapped variable placeholders in a String with the current value in this YarnState
      YarnVariable get(java.lang.String variableName)
      Returns a YarnVariable with a given name
      java.lang.String getCurrentNode()
      Returns the current node to execute against
      int getCurrentOperation()
      Returns the current operation index within the current YarnNode
      java.util.Collection<YarnVariable> getVariables()
      Returns all variables stored in the current state
      YarnVariable put(java.lang.String variableName, boolean value)
      Assigns a boolean value to a variable.

      Note: This overwrites any existing value assigned to the variable.
      YarnVariable put(java.lang.String variableName, double value)
      Assigns a double value to a variable.

      Note: This overwrites any existing value assigned to the variable.
      YarnVariable put(java.lang.String variableName, java.lang.String value)
      Assigns a String value to a variable.

      Note: This overwrites any existing value assigned to the variable.
      YarnVariable put(java.lang.String variableName, YarnValue value)
      Assigns a YarnValue to a variable

      Note: This overwrites any existing value assigned to the variable.
      YarnVariable put(java.lang.String variableName, YarnVariable value)
      Assigns the value of another YarnVariable to a variable

      Note: This overwrites any existing value assigned to the variable.
      YarnVariable putNull(java.lang.String variableName)
      Assigns null to a variable.

      Note: This overwrites any existing value assigned to the variable.
      void setCurrentNode(java.lang.String currentNode)
      Sets the current YarnNode to execute against

      Note: This will reset the operation number to 0
      void setCurrentOperation(int currentOperation)
      Sets the current operation index within the current YarnNode

    • Method Detail

      • getVariables

        public java.util.Collection<YarnVariable> getVariables()
        Returns all variables stored in the current state
        Returns:
        An empty Collection if none are stored

      • get

        public YarnVariable get(java.lang.String variableName)
        Returns a YarnVariable with a given name
        Parameters:
        variableName - The name of the variable
        Returns:
        Null if there is no such variable

      • put

        public YarnVariable put(java.lang.String variableName,
                        double value)
        Assigns a double value to a variable.

        Note: This overwrites any existing value assigned to the variable. If the variable was previously a boolean or string then a new YarnVariable instance is created and the previous one is discarded.
        Parameters:
        variableName - The variable name
        value - The value to assign
        Returns:
        The existing or new YarnVariable for the variable

      • put

        public YarnVariable put(java.lang.String variableName,
                        boolean value)
        Assigns a boolean value to a variable.

        Note: This overwrites any existing value assigned to the variable. If the variable was previously a number or string then a new YarnVariable instance is created and the previous one is discarded.
        Parameters:
        variableName - The variable name
        value - The value to assign
        Returns:
        The existing or new YarnVariable for the variable

      • put

        public YarnVariable put(java.lang.String variableName,
                        java.lang.String value)
        Assigns a String value to a variable.

        Note: This overwrites any existing value assigned to the variable. If the variable was previously a number or boolean then a new YarnVariable instance is created and the previous one is discarded.
        Parameters:
        variableName - The variable name
        value - The value to assign
        Returns:
        The existing or new YarnVariable for the variable

      • put

        public YarnVariable put(java.lang.String variableName,
                        YarnVariable value)
        Assigns the value of another YarnVariable to a variable

        Note: This overwrites any existing value assigned to the variable. If the variable was a different type then a new YarnVariable instance is created and the previous one is discarded.
        Parameters:
        variableName - The variable name
        value - The value to assign
        Returns:
        The existing or new YarnVariable for the variable

      • putNull

        public YarnVariable putNull(java.lang.String variableName)
        Assigns null to a variable.

        Note: This overwrites any existing value assigned to the variable. If the variable was previously a boolean or number then a new YarnVariable instance is created and the previous one is discarded.
        Parameters:
        variableName - The variable name
        Returns:
        The existing or new YarnVariable for the variable

      • put

        public YarnVariable put(java.lang.String variableName,
                        YarnValue value)
        Assigns a YarnValue to a variable

        Note: This overwrites any existing value assigned to the variable. If the variable was a different type then a new YarnVariable instance is created and the previous one is discarded.
        Parameters:
        variableName - The variable name
        value - The value to assign
        Returns:
        The existing or new YarnVariable for the variable

        public void setCurrentNode(java.lang.String currentNode)
        Sets the current YarnNode to execute against

        Note: This will reset the operation number to 0
        Parameters:

      • applyVariables

        public java.lang.String applyVariables(java.lang.String text)
        Replaces any {{ }} wrapped variable placeholders in a String with the current value in this YarnState
        Parameters:
        text - The String to replace variable placeholders in
        Returns:
        The String with variable values inserted
